lud_description: C-C1 is a community commercial designation that is typically for 1 to 2 storey commercial strip malls that primarily serve the immediate surrounding area.
C-C2 is a community commercial designation that is primarily for commercial developments such as strip malls and shopping centres that may serve several surrounding communities.

C-COR1 is a commercial corridor  designation that is primarily for commercial or mixed use development that must include commercial storefronts. Buildings may vary in height.  Residential units are allowed on upper floors.
C-COR2 is a commercial corridor designation that is primarily for commercial or mixed use development of varied height.  Residential units are allowed on upper floors of buildings.
C-COR3 is a commercial corridor designation that is primarily for commercial uses along major roadways.  Residential uses are not allowed.
C-N1 is a neighbourhood commercial designation that is primarily for small commercial uses in 1 to 2 storey buildings.
C-N2 is a neighbourhood commercial designation that is primarily for small commercial uses in 1 to 2 storey buildings; accessible by motor vehicle .
C-O is a commercial designation that is primarily for office buildings near major roadways and public transit facilities.
C-R1 is a regional commercial designation that is primarily for large-format ¿big box¿ stores.
C-R2 is a regional commercial designation that is primarily for large enclosed shopping malls and shopping centres.
C-R3 is a regional commercial designation that is primarily for large, mostly retail commercial developments where uses are typically in multiple buildings distributed over multiple sites.
CC-COR is a Centre City designation  primarily for commercial corridor development.
The CC-EIR designation is for intensive residential development integrated with a broad range of support commercial uses in the East Village area.
lud_name: Centre City East Village Integrated Residential District (CC-EIR)

lud_description: The CC-EMU designation is for a mix of commercial and residential uses in mid and high rise buildings in the East Village area.
lud_name: Centre City East Village Mixed Use District (CC-EMU)

lud_description: The CC-EPR designation is for intensive residential development with some support commercial uses in the East Village area.
lud_name: Centre City East Village Primarily Residential District (CC-EPR)

lud_description: The CC-ER designation is intended for public plazas next to the Bow River in the East Village area.
lud_name: Centre City East Village Recreational District (CC-ER)

lud_description: The CC-ERR designation is  for intensive residential development with ground floor commercial on sites strategically located with riverfront views in the East Village area.
lud_name: Centre City East Village River Residential District (CC-ERR)

lud_description: The CC-ET designation is for a mix of commercial, residential and institutional uses that provide an appropriate transition between the higher density downtown core and the more residential East Village.
lud_name: Centre City East Village Transition District (CC-ET)

lud_description: CC-MH is a Centre City designation primarily for high density multi-residential development.
lud_name: Centre City Multi-Residential High Rise District (CC-MH)

lud_description: CC-MHX  is a Centre City designation primarily for high density multi residential development with provisions for a range of support commercial uses.
lud_name: Centre City Multi-Residential High Rise Support Commercial District (CC-MHX)

lud_description: CC-X is a Centre City designation primarily for a mix of commercial, residential and some light industrial uses.
CR20-C20/R20 is a commercial/residential designation that is for high-rise, high-density development with a mix of commercial, residential and cultural uses within the Downtown.

A Direct Control (DC) is a customized land use designation.  It has a list of allowable uses and a set of rules specific to a particular property or development. Most DC designations include a cross-reference to the rules of one of the standard designations of the Land Use Bylaw (e.g. R-1, R-2, I-G, etc.).
I-B is an industrial designation that is primarily for business park uses with high quality buildings in a campus-like setting, typically in highly visible locations next to major roadways.
I-C is an industrial designation that allows light industrial and limited small-scale commercial uses that are compatible with adjacent industrial areas.
I-E is an industrial designation that allows a limited range of low impact light industrial uses that are suitable in close proximity to residential areas.
I-G is an industrial designation that is primarily for a wide range of general industrial uses.
I-H is a heavy industrial designation that is primarily for large, purpose built heavy industrial developments that typically locate close to hazardous goods routes and rail lines.
I-O is an industrial designation that is primarily for outdoor storage, salvage and equipment yard uses on land that has limited or no municipal services.

I-R is an industrial designation applied to seven older industrial areas that were developed before current land use standards were introduced. Properties in these areas often have significant development constraints that affect matters such as parking, access and landscaping.
The MU-1 district is for commercial and residential uses in street-oriented buildings.  The district allows both commercial and residential uses at street level.
The MU-2 district is for commercial and residential uses in street-oriented buildings.  The district requires commercial uses at street level, facing the commercial street.
M-1 is a multi-residential designation in the developing area that is primarily for 3 to 4 storey apartment buildings, townhouses and rowhouses.
M-2 is a multi-residential designation in the developing area that is primarily for 4 to 5 storey apartment buildings.
M-C1 is a multi-residential designation in the developed area that is primarily for 3 to 4 storey apartment buildings and townhouses.
M-C2 is a multi-residential designation in the developed area that is primarily for 3 to 5 storey apartment buildings.
M-CG is a multi-residential designation in the developed area that is primarily for townhouses and fourplexes.
M-G is a multi-residential designation that is primarily for townhouses and rowhouses.
M-H1 is a multi-residential designation that is primarily for 4 to 8 storey apartment buildings that may include commercial storefronts.
lud_name: Multi-Residential - High Density Low Rise District (M-H1)

lud_description: M-H2 is a multi-residential designation that is primarily for apartment buildings of varied height (4 to 15 storeys) that may include commercial storefronts.
lud_name: Multi-Residential - High Density Medium Rise District (M-H2)

lud_description: M-H3 is a multi-residential designation that is primarily for high rise apartment buildings (no predetermined maximum height) that may include commercial storefronts.
lud_name: Multi-Residential - High Density High Rise District (M-H3)

lud_description: M-X1 is a mixed-use multi-residential designation that is primarily for 3 to 4 storey apartment buildings with commercial storefronts.
lud_name: Multi-Residential - Low Profile Support Commercial District (M-X1)

lud_description: M-X2 is a mixed-use multi-residential designation that is primarily for 4 to 5 storey apartment buildings with commercial storefronts.
lud_name: Multi-Residential - Medium Profile Support Commercial District (M-X2)

lud_description: R-1 is a residential designation in developing areas that is primarily for single detached homes.
R-1N is a residential designation in developing areas that is primarily for single detached homes on narrow or small parcels where homes may include a secondary suite.
lud_name: Residential -  Narrow Parcel One Dwelling District (R-1N)

lud_description: R-1s is a residential designation in developing areas that is primarily for single detached homes that may include a secondary suite.
R-2 is a residential designation in developing areas that is primarily for single detached, side-by-side and duplex homes.  Single detached homes may include a secondary suite.
R-2M is a residential designation in developing areas that is primarily for side-by-side homes and rowhouses.
lud_name: Residential - Low Density Multiple Dwelling District (R-2M)

lud_description: R-C1 is a residential designation in developed areas that is primarily for single detached homes.
R-C1L is a residential designation in developed areas that is primarily for single detached homes on large parcels.
lud_name: Residential  - Contextual Large Parcel One Dwelling District (R-C1L)

lud_description: R-C1Ls is a residential designation in developed areas that is primarily for single detached homes on large parcels where homes may include a secondary suite.
lud_name: Residential - Contextual Large Parcel One Dwelling District, (R-C1Ls)

lud_description: R-C1N is a residential designation in developed areas that is primarily for single detached homes on narrow or small parcels where homes may include a secondary suite.
lud_name: Residential - Contextual Narrow Parcel One Dwelling District (R-C1N)

lud_description: R-C1s is a residential designation in developed areas that is primarily for single detached homes that may include a secondary suite.
R-C2 is a residential designation in developed areas that is primarily for single detached, side-by-side and duplex homes.  Single detached homes may include a secondary suite.
lud_name: Residential - Contextual One / Two Dwelling District, (R-C2)

lud_description: R-CG is a residential designation that is primarily for rowhouses but also allows for single detached, side-by-side and duplex homes that may include a secondary suite.

The R-G district is for a mix of low density housing forms in suburban greenfield locations , including single-detached, side by side, duplex , cottage housing clusters  and rowhouse development, all of which may include secondary suite.

The R-Gm district is for a range of low density housing forms in suburban greenfield locations , including side by side, duplex , cottage housing clusters  and rowhouse development (but excluding single detached), all of which may include a secondary suite.
R-MH is a residential designation that is for mobile home parks.
The S-CI designation is primarily for large scale culture, worship, education, health and treatment facilities.
The S-CRI designation is primarily for infrastructure and utility facilities, including public transportation operated by the federal, provincial and municipal levels of government.
lud_name: Special Purpose - City and Regional Infrastructure District (S-CRI)

lud_description: The S-CS designation is for education and community uses. It accommodates a limited range of small scale public recreation facilities, both indoor and outdoor, on land not designated reserve land under the Municipal Government Act.
The S-FUD designation is primarily for lands that are awaiting urban development and is largely limited to uses that can easily be removed to allow for future urban development.
lud_name: Special Purpose - Future Urban Development District (S-FUD)

lud_description: The S-R designation is primarily for private recreation facilities, both indoor and outdoor.
The S-SPR designation is for public parks, open space, schools and recreation facilities on land designated as 'reserve land' under the Municipal Government Act.
lud_name: Special Purpose - School, Park and Community Reserve District, (S-SPR)

lud_description: The S-TUC designation is primarily for provincial transportation facilities and utilities.  Certain other compatible uses, if temporary and removable, may be allowed.
lud_name: Special Purpose - Transportation and Utility Corridor District (S-TUC)

lud_description: The S-UN designation is for lands that are to be retained in their natural state or are being rehabilitated to replicate a natural state.

The S-URP designation is for facilities engaged in scientific research, research and development and technology commercialization, typically in association with the University of Calgary and the provincial and federal governments.
lud_name: Special Purpose - University Research Park District, (S-URP)

lud_description: A road right of way (i.e. a public road) has no legal description and no land use designation.  Therefore, a road right of way is '"undesignated".
